alert.note: Alert for Cabarrus; Davie; Iredell; Mecklenburg; Rowan (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 09 at 4:34AM EST until January 09 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of the western Piedmont of North Carolina, including the following areas, Cabarrus, Davie, Iredell, Mecklenburg, Rowan and Union NC and upstate South Carolina, including the following areas, Chester, Union SC and York. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A powerful low pressure system will spread heavy rain across the region overnight through Tuesday. Rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are expected across the eastern Upstate of South Carolina and the Piedmont of North Carolina. Embedded thunderstorms repeatedly affecting any of these areas could produce locally higher amounts. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Watch for flash flooding means there is a potential for rapid onset flooding based on current forecasts. Flash flooding is a very dangerous situation and may impact areas that do not typically flood. Please monitor the latest forecasts and be prepared to take action quickly should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
